def.dt: :to make (food, such as bread and cake) by preparing a dough, batter, etc., and cooking it in an oven using dry heat + obj I baked you a cake. = I baked a cake for you. freshly baked bread [=bread that was baked recently] no obj He likes to bake. = He enjoys baking. [=he likes making pies, muffins, cookies, etc.]

:to cook (food) in an oven using dry heat + obj Bake [=roast] the chicken for 30 minutes. baked potatoes She wrapped the fish in foil and baked it for 15 minutes. no obj used in recipes Wrap the fish in foil and bake for 15 minutes.
:to be cooked in an oven The turkey has been baking [=roasting] for an hour. How long has the cake been baking?
:to make (something, such as clay or mud) dry and hard by using heat They baked the bricks in the sun.
:to be or become very hot The streets were baking in the afternoon heat. We stood baking [=sweltering] under the hot desert sun. see also half-baked

utxt.vi: We stood in the baking heat.

def.dt: :an event in which people try to earn money by selling baked foods (such as cookies and pies) They organized a bake sale to raise money for the church.
